body_html: @Kaixhin It is a wide-reaching issue but IMHO it doesn't affect batchnorm/instancenorm/... as they have their C implementation in the backend, which does not rely on autograd's sqrt. But you are right, std() should be fixed as norm() was fixed.
body_text: @Kaixhin It is a wide-reaching issue but IMHO it doesn't affect batchnorm/instancenorm/... as they have their C implementation in the backend, which does not rely on autograd's sqrt. But you are right, std() should be fixed as norm() was fixed.
body: @Kaixhin It is a wide-reaching issue but IMHO it doesn't affect batchnorm/instancenorm/... as they have their C implementation in the backend, which does not rely on autograd's `sqrt`. But you are right, `std()` should be fixed as `norm()` was fixed.
